title: Pe̍h-ōe-jī
summary: Pe̍h-ōe-jī (Taiwanese Hokkien: [pe˩˩ ˀo̯e̞˩˩ d͡ʑi˧˧] (listen); abbreviated POJ; literally vernacular writing; also sometimes known as the Church Romanization) is an orthography used to write variants of Southern Min Chinese, particularly Taiwanese Hokkien and Amoy Hokkien.
